meanings.definition: A brown pigment made from boiling wood soot
meanings.sent1: The artist used bistres to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent2: The old book had illustrations in bistres on every page.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child mistook bistres for chocolate powder and made a mess.
meanings.sent4: The bistres of the forest at dusk painted a serene picture.
meanings.sent5: The smell of bistres reminded her of cozy winter evenings by the fireplace.

meanings.sent1: Her hair had a lovely bistres hue that shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.sent3: The bistres of the chocolate cake made it look extra decadent.
meanings.sent4: The bistres of the soil hinted at the fertility of the land.
meanings.sent5: The bistres of the old photograph gave it a nostalgic feel.
